title: Analysis of eLearning Education Barriers for Ugandan Executives and Development of Solution Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced expertise in business administration and basic digital literacy skills
context.additional_context: MBA program linked for in-service professionals, in a digital device-provided environment

learning_goals: Three core infrastructure issues hindering Uganda's e-learning environment can be identified through quantitative data.
At least two culturally tailored instructional design strategies to enhance learner engagement can be proposed.
A phased educational approach to address digital literacy gaps can be applied to real-world cases.
A plan to measure instructional effectiveness using formative assessment tools in blended learning environments can be designed.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
